member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with set to .

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: true if a element should be localized; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns whether the value of the given object is equal to the current .
member.param: The object to test the value equality of.
member.returns: true if the value of the given object is equal to that of the current; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for the current .

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute.Required
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a element should be localized. true if a element should be localized; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.FormatParameterName
member.summary: Gets format parameter name

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, has such parameter.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function is used to notify class type property value is changed.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked element could never be null

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function definition table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using "halt" (or "void"/"nothing", which is the same) for method output means that methos doesn't return normally.
"canbenull" annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

list.item: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // Regular Assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // String.IsNullOrEmpty
[ContractAnnotation("null => null; notnull => notnull")] public object Transform(object data) // Method which returns null if parameter is null, and not null if parameter is not null
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators. There is only exception to compare with null, it is permitted

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type which is marked with target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of BaseTypeRequiredAttribute

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute.BaseTypes
member.summary: Gets enumerations of specified base types

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute.TargetFlags
member.summary: Gets value indicating what is meant to be used

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute.TargetFlags
member.summary: Gets value indicating what is meant to be used

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method doesn't contain observable side effects. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute
